title: ‘I was never worried’: 10 years on since Syrian siblings’ 2,700-mile escape to Germany
summary: Ten years after Angela Merkel's famous pledge during the 2015 migration crisis, Syrian refugee Somar Kreker reflects on his challenging 44-day journey to safety in Europe. Kreker's experience highlights the ongoing struggles faced by refugees amid changing dynamics surrounding migration policy and integration. His story serves as a poignant reminder of the human impact behind political promises.

title: The rise of dog-friendly cinema screenings: ‘We never have to break up fights – there’s enough trouble with the humans’
summary: Dog owners are flocking to "mutt-iplexes" for special movie screenings tailored for pets. A writer, accompanied by his hesitant dog, attends a showing of The Fantastic Four to uncover the allure of these canine-friendly events. The trend highlights the growing bond between pets and their owners in shared entertainment experiences.

title: My favourite childhood outfit: ‘I loved my homemade hat – the strong papal vibes were unintentional’
summary: The speaker reflects on their childhood creativity, wishing that their handmade hats from age four would be displayed at the Costume Institute in the Met. This longing for recognition underscores a sense of lost potential. Consequently, they decided to move away from their DIY fashion endeavors.

title: Winter delivers final blast of cold weather, bringing snow and strong winds to Australia’s south-east
summary: A strong weather front has moved through South Australia, Victoria, and New South Wales, bringing significant effects. According to the Bureau of Meteorology (BoM), the front has now passed and is clearing into the Tasman Sea. Residents can expect improved weather conditions following the front's departure.
